title:

Embracing risks allows individuals to grasp new opportunities and pursue their dreams, ultimately leading to a more fulfilling life.

title: Plastic bags, plastic bottles and plastic packaging are bad for environment. What damage does plastic do to the environment? What can be done by governments and individuals to solve this problem?
content:
These days the items made of the plastic such as bottles and packaging are becoming a huge threat to our environment. These non biodegradable materials have detrimental effects on the fertility of soil and purity of air as well as water. Authorities and people should take stern steps like banning the use and manufacturing of plastic items as well as implementing the concept of reduce and reuse.

To start with, the prime damaging effect of plastic on our surroundings is that it reduces the productivity of soil. Being a water resistant material, plastic prevents the rain water from seeping into the ground. Thereby, it reduces the level of moisture much needed for the fruit fullness of soil and turns the land into barren. Furthermore, it takes hundreds of years for a single plastic bottle to decompose in our ecosystem. Therefore, to get rid of the heaps of plastic waste, people generally burn the domestic and industrial non degradable waste, and this process emits extremely harmful gases namely carbon monoxide and nitrous oxide. These gases deteriorate the quality of air and accelerate the air pollution by increasing the percentage of minute particles. In addition, the chemicals in the plastic products often reach water bodies and affect the quality of water. This results in the devastation of marine wildlife and vegetation.

To resolve the issues caused by plastic products on our ecosystem / environment, the government should issue strict guidelines like banning the utilisation of single use plastic as well as its manufacturing. Owing to these measures, the presence of unwanted material will automatically decrease in our surroundings. Gradually, the quality of air, soil and water will improve. Similarly, people should apply the policy of reducing and reusing the material. If people use carry bags made of cloth instead of plastic, it will prove as a turning point in protecting / saving our ecosystem. Also people should adopt the habit of reusing and recycling the products available to them. This will control the consumption and manufacturing of articles of plastic. In other words, joint efforts of the administration and citizens are required to bring about a drastic change.

To conclude, plastic pollutes the air, water and soil and thus harms our environment in so many ways. Collective efforts of the government and the public are required to control the use and abuse of plastic.

title: In education and employment, some people work harder than others. Why do some people work harder? Is it always a good thing to work hard?
content:
In the domains of education and employment, the level of effort people invest in their work can significantly vary. Some individuals display remarkable dedication and perseverance, while others seem less motivated to put in the extra effort. This discrepancy in work ethics raises questions about the reasons behind these differences and whether working harder is always advantageous. Understanding the underlying factors and implications of varying work ethics is crucial to foster a more productive and balanced workforce.

Several factors contribute to the differences in work ethics among individuals. Intrinsic motivation plays a vital role, with passionate individuals having clear goals and being more inclined to work harder. Cultural background and upbringing also influence work ethics, as those raised in environments that value hard work are more likely to exhibit a strong work ethic. Moreover, external incentives, recognition, and rewards in the workplace or educational settings can influence an individual's willingness to put in extra effort.

Working harder often leads to numerous benefits. It enhances productivity and efficiency, resulting in higher output and improved performance. Diligent individuals are more likely to acquire advanced skills, positioning themselves for better career opportunities. Moreover, their commitment and dedication can inspire others, fostering a positive and competitive environment. In the context of education, hardworking students tend to achieve higher grades, gain a deeper understanding of subjects, and develop valuable study habits for the future.

While working harder can bring several advantages, it is not always a universally beneficial approach. Striking a balance between dedication and maintaining personal well-being is essential to avoid burnout and ensure sustainable success. Encouraging a culture that values hard work while recognizing the importance of work-life balance can lead to a more productive and fulfilled workforce.

title: Many students find it difficult to pay attention at school. What are the reasons for this? What could be done to solve this problem?

Primarily, the lack of attention is due to the traditional teaching techniques followed by institutions. The teachers are instructing students to memorise the answers instead of engaging in brainstorming and creative learning activities. The students rely on their memory and write the answer in the examination, which becomes the reason for frustration among the students. The use of portable devices such as mobile phones during lectures is another source of distraction. Alternatively, if instructors in schools use active learning techniques, in which each student is given the opportunity to exhibit what they have learned, students' learning will increase. Teachers should also use a variety of instructional strategies to pique students' interest and engagement, such as presenting videos, engaging through presentations, and personally contacting students. Finally, because distractions like video games and cell phones are the most prevalent cause of a child's lack of interest in studying, they should be banned in schools, and parents should impose a daily usage restriction on them. 

To sum up, modern teaching techniques should be implemented in order to develop students' enthusiasm for learning and gadgets should be prohibited and limited because they tend to act as a barrier and reduce students' effectiveness

It is considered that increasing the supply of some famous consumable item which was actually not in demand can be achieved with the influence of advertisement. I completely agree with this concept because an interesting presentation creates curiosity and most people fall for it despite the real cost-benefit-need analysis. In this essay, we will see how it works with some examples.

Firstly,  advertisements create an interactive interface in a person's mind and when they are interesting and relevant by any means induce desire. In my hometown, people are fond of making a special sweet called Khasta as it is a household name and included in everyday meals. Citizens use traditional equipment made of wood to shape it as shaping with hands is tedious and time-consuming. A famous Kitchen utensil manufacturer developed the same device out of steel and brought it into the market but was unsuccessful. Then they began advertising after 3 years of product lunch and soon their sales tripled the following year. But soon the habitats realized that the sweet was missing in taste, texture and durability. 

Later, after numerous consumer complaints, the local government began to investigate. when the inspection was completed it was found that there was no problem with the manufacturer's equipment but it was the wood which rich the taste. The report says  it was the specific wood which has a unique compound called "bibi" in the local language which adds flavour to the sweet and was responsible for the preservation for a longer duration whereas the steel lacks that. Moreover, the tree was locally inhabited so the multinational manufacturer had no knowledge about it. They found that the product is very popular in other states however so, it would be an easy go, it did but did not prolong.

Overall, the power of advertisement does increase sales in the market where there is no demand but how long the demand lasts is completely dependent on the consumer. Hence, I would suggest making proper research on the actual practice of the habitats before launching the device into the market.

title: Environmental problems such as pollution and climatic variations are increasing nowadays. The governments have taken some measures at a global level. But they got only few solutions. Why is it so? How can this be solved?
content:

If we compare the world now to 100 years ago, we can identify the problem. In the past, people lived in rural areas and consumed what they grew. However, after the industrial revolution, more communities migrated to cities and their habits shifted from being producers to consumers. Companies now strive to sell their products in order to increase their wealth, and governments do not have the authority to limit them, so even in developed countries this problem remained as it was. Additionally, the media industry and the internet assist companies in reaching customers worldwide. Resulting in increased use of fossil fuel products delivery. For instance, wooden types of furniture can produce in any country, but for the sake of advertisements, imported type is used.

Another issue is the encouragement of excessive consumption. In the past one car was sufficient for a family, but now it has become common for each person to own their own car. With the increasing human population on Earth, the need for food is undeniable. As a result, organizations are employing conservation and other production techniques to produce and store food for longer periods of time or cutting trees of jungles to build construction for industrial reasons. However, this leads to the use of more industrial machines, facilities and pesticides in agriculture. While there are benefits to these practices, associations often use excessive amounts of water and pollute it before returning to nature. For example, in my country, one of the most well-known companies is a major contributor to water pollution as they release dirty water into rivers, and the government cannot do anything about it.

In summary, these changes are inevitable, but humans are accelerating them. The only way to slow down these changes is by teaching people to love the Earth like other creatures in the world.

title: People from older generations have difficulty using smartphones and new technology. What is the cause of this? What are some possible solutions?

For instance, conquering the moon was beyond the imagination. However, analysis blocks like NASA, Space X,  and many others around the world had achieved this milestone.

content:
This diagram illustrates the various stages of manufacturing matches. 

In general, to begin the creation of matches consists of four stages: cleaning to drying, and this is before being sent to production. This is followed by six stages, beginning with the input of sticks and ending with boxes of the finished product.

In the first phase, the revolving log is peeled by using a blade, followed by cutting the veneer into sticks. Next, they are immersed in a tank that contains ammonium phosphate. Subsequently, almost 60% of the moisture is dehydrated by Withering the tea leaves on a rack.Next, the leaves can be processed by the novel method where the leaves are cut, torn and curled, and this results in a more efficient way of producing small granular bits in tea bags. On the one hand, parents choose to let their children carry out free time activities on their own to develop independence. Furthermore, not having to spend time with a lot of people allows them to avoid disagreements with friends. Children find it easier to play online games than to go out to the park. On the other hand, research indicates that collaboration between young children enhances social and confidence skills. Secondly, spending time with peers' supports the development of confidence. Therefore,  it is important that children should get out of their comfort zone and meet people to strengthen life's essential skills such as social and confidence skills.

In summary, some people think children should spend time on their own, while others think they should socialise. I think the latter is essential because it helps with skills for social life and confidence.

To begin with, I believe free water facilities should only be free for people in public places, remote areas, or slum areas so that people can get clean, drinkable water free of charge. For example, in Indian villages and public places, railway stations, parks, and bazaars, clear tap water is viable for residents.  But, for residential or commercial use in cities or towns, For instance, in India, city authorities charge monthly water bills for water supplies. This method has discouraged civilians from wasting water. Nevertheless, some years ago, when tap water was free, per capita water utilization was considerably higher in urban areas.

Nowadays, the sale of bottled water is increasing significantly across the world and there are some specific reasons why  it should not be banned. Firstly, before packing water in bottles, it is properly purified so that it does impact the consumers. In other words, water purification standards are met by companies becoming water bottled, while in some countries, like India, Public tap water is too polluted and can cause health issues hence people avoid even free water and prepared packed water for drinking. Secondly, the suggestion of banning packed water would not be accepted by companies and the government would face agitation, if they go for implementing it. Because this decision will adversely impact the earnings of the bottled water business. Hence it is practically impossible to stop the sales of bottled water.

All in all, I believe that government should not put restrictions on the sale of bottled water and even it is difficult to impossible to make it free for every individual.

In conclusion, although fast food may be efficient, easy to prepare and taste good, we have to limit the consumption of this kind of food as it can have serious negative effects on our bodies.
